other_tests.findings: No abnormalities except for sinus tachycardia.
Mild mitral regurgitation without evidence of mitral-valve prolapse. Mild-to-moderate aortic regurgitation with eccentric jet angled at anterior mitral leaflet. Aortic annulus and root were dilated.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Aortic diameter measurements were reported as 40 mm at sinuses of Valsalva, 42 mm at sinotubular junction, and 47 mm at ascending aorta (compared to normal values).

other_tests.findings: A focal linear flap distal to the aortic valve, consistent with presence of a type A dissection. The aorta was slightly dilated to 4.4 cm.
Normal aortic contour, streaky density in the mediastinum, area of slightly increased density consistent with extravascular hematoma, small pericardial effusion, ascending aorta dilated to 4.5 cm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial imaging studies did not provide a specific diagnosis, thus additional diagnostic testing was indicated.
